item.name: Barman Check
item.description:
This is the master item for this template. Both the discovery itself and all items discovered depent on this item.
It performs a check of all configured PostgreSQL Barman backups using this UserParameter: UserParameter=barman.check,/usr/bin/sudo -u barman /usr/bin/barman -f json check all

trigger.name: PostgreSQL Barman gives no data!
trigger.description: Barman Check does not work/gives no data. No monitoring of PostgreSQL backup status possible due to this error.

trigger_prototype.name: Barman Backup {#BARMAN.BACKUP}: Archiver has errors
trigger_prototype.description: The Barman archiver experienced some errors. Check the Barman logfile and the error directory for this archiver and resolve the issue there.

trigger_prototype.name: Barman Backup {#BARMAN.BACKUP}: Archive Command failed
trigger_prototype.description: Check why the archive command failed and resolve the issue. Correct archiving is important to restore operation on failed PostgreSQL nodes

trigger_prototype.name: Barman Backup {#BARMAN.BACKUP}: Archive Mode is not ok
trigger_prototype.description: This is most likely a barman configuration problem that has to be resolved to allow correct archiving

trigger_prototype.name: Barman Backup {#BARMAN.BACKUP}: Backup maximum age exceeded
trigger_prototype.description: The youngest Barman base backup is older that the configured threshold. This means that there is a problem either with the configuration or the execution of base backups.

trigger_prototype.name: Barman Backup {#BARMAN.BACKUP}: Compression settings error
trigger_prototype.description: The compression settings for base backups are not ok - verify and check your configuration

trigger_prototype.name: Barman Backup {#BARMAN.BACKUP}: Continuous archiving failed
trigger_prototype.description: Barman continuous archiving failed. Check the Barman logfile and the error directory for this archiver and resolve the issue there.

trigger_prototype.name: Barman Backup {#BARMAN.BACKUP}: Directories misconfigured
trigger_prototype.description: The Barman directories are not ok. Check log file, configuration and file system layout.

trigger_prototype.name: Barman Backup {#BARMAN.BACKUP}: Failed backups
trigger_prototype.description:
Barman has failed base backups. Check the logfiles and the overall status of barman.
A failed backup might not be a big problem, if you have more intact base backups as well as ongoing WAL archiving

trigger_prototype.name: Barman Backup {#BARMAN.BACKUP}: Minimum redundancy not fulfilled
trigger_prototype.description: There are less base backups in storage than configured. Check for backup issues and misconfigurations (especially cron jobs for backup creation and retention)

trigger_prototype.name: Barman Backup {#BARMAN.BACKUP}: pg_basebackup access failed
trigger_prototype.description: This usually means that Barmancannot find pg_basebackup on the PostgreSQL server node, resolve either there or in Barman configuration

trigger_prototype.name: Barman Backup {#BARMAN.BACKUP}: pg_basebackup incompatible
trigger_prototype.description: The version of pg_basebackup on a database server node is not compatible with this Barman version

item_prototype.name: Barman Backup {#BARMAN.BACKUP}: pg_basebackup supports tablespace mapping

trigger_prototype.name: Barman Backup {#BARMAN.BACKUP}: Tablespace mapping not supported
trigger_prototype.description: pg_basebackup does not support tablespace mapping in the available version, but it should

trigger_prototype.name: Barman Backup {#BARMAN.BACKUP}: pg_receivexlog access failed
trigger_prototype.description: Barman cannot access pg_receivexlog, check its installation and Barman configuration

trigger_prototype.name: Barman Backup {#BARMAN.BACKUP}: pg_receivexlog incompatible
trigger_prototype.description: pg_receivexlog is not compatible with the used Barman version

trigger_prototype.name: Barman Backup {#BARMAN.BACKUP}: PostgreSQL error
trigger_prototype.description: Barman can not access PostgreSQL correctly. Check if it is running and if Barman has the necessary rights to it.

trigger_prototype.name: Barman Backup {#BARMAN.BACKUP}: PostgreSQL streaming error
trigger_prototype.description: Barman can not stream correctly from PostgreSQL. Check the logfile for more details

trigger_prototype.name: Barman Backup {#BARMAN.BACKUP}: Receive WAL not running
trigger_prototype.description: Barman is currently not receiving WALs - a point-in-time-recovery is impossible without them.

trigger_prototype.name: Barman Backup {#BARMAN.BACKUP}: Replication slot failed
trigger_prototype.description: Barmans replication slot is not set up or available in PostgreSQL

trigger_prototype.name: Barman Backup {#BARMAN.BACKUP}: Retention policy error
trigger_prototype.description: The Barman retention policy settings are incorrect.

trigger_prototype.name: Barman Backup {#BARMAN.BACKUP}: Backup privileges insufficient
trigger_prototype.description: Barman user does not have the necessary access rights for this PostgreSQL database.

trigger_prototype.name: Barman Backup {#BARMAN.BACKUP}: System ID Coherence error
trigger_prototype.description: Check Barman log files for more details.

trigger_prototype.name: Barman Backup {#BARMAN.BACKUP}: WAL Level error
trigger_prototype.description: WAL Level is not what it should be, check Barman log files
